title: Ammanford Walks

images.title: Nigel Davies / Ammanford Park (Recreated)
images.caption: Ammanford Park. A view of the bandstand and cricket pitch taken from the entrance on Tir-y-dail Lane. On the horizon beyond the end of the path, All Saints Church can be seen on the hill.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Betws Park, near Ammanford
images.caption: Betws Park, near Ammanford. The river Amman forms the west boundary of this park.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Bridge over Amman river, joining Ammanford and Betws
images.caption: Bridge over Amman river, joining Ammanford and Betws

images.title: Hywel Williams / Old Pontamman road bridge
images.caption:
Quay Street.  Looking north up Quay St, from near the junction with Hall St and angled towards the east side.
The street is pedestrianised, and the terraced red brick buildings in the extreme distance have had their pinnacled dormer windows removed when the roof was replaced.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Ammanford Park
images.caption: Ammanford Park. Visible are the cricket pitch, bandstand and tennis courts. In the distance behind the hedges is the playground, and out of shot to the left is a bowling green.

images.title: Nigel Davies / The Gorsedd stone circle, Ammanford
images.caption: The Gorsedd stone circle, Ammanford. This is a relatively modern construction only about a century old. The Gorsedd stone circle is where the Eisteddfod was held, whenever it came to town. It lies on a hill near the middle of town, just higher up than All Saints church. The small patch of grass it occupies is now surrounded by new houses.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Wind Street, Ammanford (Recreated)
images.caption: Wind Street. The view is looking northeast towards the town centre along Wind Street from its junction with the road to Pantyffynnon.

description: This former coal mining town is located in Carmarthenshire on the Heart of Wales Line . Local walking highlights include Llyn Llech Owain which lies just to the west. The country park includes peaceful woodland and some pleasant waterside trails around the pretty lake. To the north is the splendid Dinefwr Park in nearby Llandeilo . This walk in the town takes you through Ammanford Park to Betws Park where there are some nice trails along the River Amman. The Amman Valley Route is a shared cycling and walking trail running from Pantyffynnon to Brynamman via Ammanford. The traffic free path runs along the river with some splendid views to enjoy on the way. Scroll down for a list of walks in the local area.
